fields.headline: Bellamy accused of racist abuse
fields.bodyText: Newcastle striker Craig Bellamy has been accused of racial and verbal abuse in an alleged incident that occurred in Cardiff last night. The Wales and Newcastle striker was in his home town in the build-up to Wales' Euro 2004 qualifiers against Azerbaijan on Saturday and Serbia and Montenegro the following Wednesday. The incident is believed to have happened late last night at the Millenium Plaza as the rest of Mark Hughes' squad assembled at the team hotel on the outskirts of the city. Hughes said: "There has been an incident, but no, he has not been sent home. He didn't train on Monday but I hope he will be fit for the weekend." FAW spokesman Ceri Stennett added: "We are investigating, but wish to make no further comment." South Wales Police issued a statement saying: "Enquiries are on-going into an incident."
